schema.description: The ID of the backup plan. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

The location of the database. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter. Valid values:

- **RDS**

- **ECS**

- **Express**: a database connected over a leased line, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway

- **Agent**: a database connected through a backup gateway

- **DDS**: Alibaba Cloud MongoDB

- **Other**: a database connected over the internet

The region where the database resides. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if SourceEndpointInstanceType is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or **Agent**.

The ID of the database instance. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if **SourceEndpointInstanceType** is set to **RDS**, **ECS**, **DDS**, or **Express**.

The database endpoint. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if **SourceEndpointInstanceType** is set to **Express**, **Agent**, or **Other**.

The database port. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if **SourceEndpointInstanceType** is set to **Express**, **Agent**, **Other**, or **ECS**.

The name of the database. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if the database type is **PostgreSQL** or **MongoDB**.

The database account.

> This parameter is not required if the database type is **Redis**, or if the database is connected through a backup gateway (**Agent**) and the database type is **SQL Server**. In all other scenarios, this parameter is required.

The password for the database account.

> This parameter is not required if the database type is **Redis**, or if the database is connected through a backup gateway (**Agent**) and the database type is **SQL Server**. In all other scenarios, this parameter is required.

The ID of the backup gateway. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

> This parameter is required if **SourceEndpointInstanceType** is set to **Agent**.

The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket.

> The system automatically generates a new name by default.
The backup objects. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

schema.description:
The full backup cycle. Valid values:

- **Monday**

- **Tuesday**

- **Wednesday**

- **Thursday**

- **Friday**

- **Saturday**

- **Sunday**

The start time for the full backup. The time is in the *HH:mm*Z format. The time is displayed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

Specifies whether to enable incremental log backup. Valid values:

- **true**: enabled

- **false**: disabled

The interval for incremental backups, in seconds.

> This parameter is valid only for physical backups.
The retention period for backup data, in days. Valid values: 0 to 1825. The default value is 730.
The number of days after which backup data is converted to the Infrequent Access (IA) storage class. The default value is 180.
The number of days after which backup data is converted to the Archive storage class. The default value is 365.
The custom name of the backup plan. Call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

The Oracle system ID (SID).

> This parameter is required if the database type is Oracle.

The storage type for the backup. Valid values:

- Empty (default): Backup data is stored in your OSS bucket.

- system: Backup data is stored in the built-in OSS bucket of DBS.

The disk I/O limit. Unit: KB/s.

> This parameter is valid only for physical backups of MySQL databases.

The network bandwidth throttling. Unit: KB/s. The maximum value is 10 GB.

> This parameter is valid only for physical backups of MySQL databases.

The full backup strategy. Valid values:

- **simple**: periodic backup. Use this value with the BackupPeriod and BackupStartTime parameters.

- **manual**: manual backup.

> The default value is **simple**.
The user ID (UID) of the Alibaba Cloud account for cross-account backup. Call the [DescribeRestoreTaskList](~~2869838~~) operation to obtain this parameter.
The name of the Resource Access Management (RAM) role for cross-account backup. Call the [DescribeRestoreTaskList](~~2869838~~) operation to obtain this parameter.

Specifies whether to enable automatic backup.

- **true**: enabled

- **false**: disabled

A client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that the value is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.
The resource group ID.
The details of the response.

CreateRestoreTask.summary: Creates a Database Backup Service (DBS) restore job.

schema.description: The ID of the backup plan.

The location of the database. Valid values:

- **RDS**

- **ECS**

- **Express**: a database connected over a leased line, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.

- **Agent**: a database connected using a backup gateway.

- **DDS**: a cloud MongoDB instance.

- **Other**: a database connected over the Internet.

- **dg**: a self-managed database that does not have a public IP address and port. This type of database is connected using Database Gateway (DG).

The region of the database instance.

> This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent.

The ID of the database instance.

> This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to RDS, ECS, DDS, or Express.

The database endpoint.

> This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to express, agent, or other.

The database port.

> This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to express, agent, other, or ECS.

The name of the database.

> This parameter is required if the database type is PostgreSQL or MongoDB.

The database account.

> This parameter is not required if the database type is Redis, or if DestinationEndpointInstanceType is set to agent and the database type is MSSQL. In other scenarios, this parameter is required.

The password.

> This parameter is not required if the database type is Redis, or if DestinationEndpointInstanceType is set to agent and the database type is MSSQL. In other scenarios, this parameter is required.

The ID of the backup gateway.

> This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent.

The objects to restore.

- This parameter is not required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent. In other scenarios, this parameter is required.

- Template: `[{ "DBName": "source_database_name", "NewDBName": "destination_database_name" }]`

> When you use this API operation, you can only restore objects at the database level. To restore specific tables, use the console. For more information, see [Restore a database](~~85543~~).
The restore time, specified as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.
The ID of the full backup set used for the restore. This parameter is mutually exclusive with RestoreTime.
The name of the restore job.

The Oracle system ID (SID).

> This parameter is required if the database type is Oracle.
This parameter is required if **DestinationEndpointInstanceType** is set to agent and the backup plan is for a MySQL database.
The directory of the database program.

The policy for handling conflicts with objects that have the same name. The following value is supported:

**renamenew**: If an object with the same name exists, rename the new object.
The UID of the Alibaba Cloud account for cross-account backup.
The name of the RAM role for cross-account backup.
A client token used to ensure the idempotence of the request. This prevents duplicate submissions.
The response parameters.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

RestoreTaskId.description: The ID of the restore job.

schema.description:
The DBS region. Valid values:

- **cn-hangzhou**: China (Hangzhou)

- **cn-shanghai**: China (Shanghai)

- **cn-qingdao**: China (Qingdao)

- **cn-beijing**: China (Beijing)

- **cn-shenzhen**: China (Shenzhen)

- **cn-hongkong**: China (Hong Kong)

- **ap-southeast-1**: Singapore

- **cn-hangzhou-finance**: China (Hangzhou) Finance

- **cn-shanghai-finance**: China (Shanghai) Finance

- **cn-shenzhen-finance**: China (Shenzhen) Finance
The unique identifier of the backup gateway. To query multiple gateways, separate the identifiers with commas (,).

The number of records on each page. Valid values:

- **30**

- **50**

- **100**

> The default value is 30.
The page number. The value must be greater than or equal to 0 and cannot exceed the maximum value of an integer. The default value is 0.
A client token used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the backup gateway.

BackupGatewayCreateTime.description: The time when the backup gateway was created. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: milliseconds.

BackupGatewayId.description: The ID of the backup gateway.

Identifier.description: The unique identifier of the backup gateway.

SourceEndpointInternetIP.description: The public IP address of the host where the backup gateway is installed.

BackupGatewayStatus.description:
The status of the backup gateway. Valid values:

- ONLINE: The gateway is online.

- OFFLINE: The gateway is offline.

- STOPPED: The gateway is stopped.

- UPGRADING: The gateway is being upgraded.

SourceEndpointIntranetIP.description: The private IP address of the host where the backup gateway is installed.

LastHeartbeatTime.description: The time of the last heartbeat. The value is a UNIX timestamp. Unit: milliseconds.

SourceEndpointHostname.description: The hostname of the host where the backup gateway is installed.

schema.description: The ID of the backup plan. To query multiple backup plans, separate the IDs with commas (,).

The number of entries to return on each page. Valid values: 1 to 100.

The name of the backup plan.

The status of the backup plan. Valid values:

- **wait**: The backup plan is not configured.

- **init**: The backup plan is not started because the precheck failed.

- **running**: The backup plan is running.

- **stop**: The backup plan has failed.

- **pause**: The backup plan is paused.

- **locked**: The backup plan is locked.

- **check\_pass**: The precheck is passed.

TotalElements.description: The total number of backup plans.

PageSize.description: The number of entries on each page.

BackupPlanDetail.description: The details of the backup plan.

CrossRoleName.description: The name of the RAM role for cross-account backup.

SourceEndpointInstanceType.description:
The location of the database. Valid values:

- **rds**

- **ecs**

- **express**: A database connected over a leased line, VPN Gateway, or Smart Access Gateway.

- **agent**: A database connected through a backup gateway.

- **dds**: A MongoDB instance.

BackupSetDownloadDir.description: The directory on the server where the backup set is downloaded.

EndTimestampForRestore.description: The end of the time range during which the database can be restored. This is a UNIX timestamp.

BackupPlanStatus.description:
The status of the backup plan. Valid values:

- **wait**: The backup plan is not configured.

- **init**: The backup plan is not started because the precheck failed.

- **running**: The backup plan is running.

- **stop**: The backup plan has failed.

- **pause**: The backup plan is paused.

- **locked**: The backup plan is locked.

- **check\_pass**: The precheck is passed.

BackupStorageType.description:

The backup method. Valid values:

- **logical**: Logical backup

- **physical**: Physical backup

- **duplication**: Dump backup

- **Thursday**

- **Saturday**

- **Sunday**

- **micro**: Micro

- **small**: Small

- **medium**: Medium

- **large**: Large

- **xlarge**: Extra Large (no traffic limit)

schema.description:
The ID of the backup plan. You can call the [DescribeBackupPlanList](~~2869825~~) operation to obtain the ID.

> You must specify either **BackupPlanId** or **BackupSetDownloadTaskId**.

The ID of the backup set download task.

- For a full backup, call the [CreateFullBackupSetDownload](~~2869842~~) operation to obtain the task ID.

- For an incremental backup, call the [CreateIncrementBackupSetDownload](~~2869843~~) operation to obtain the task ID.

The number of entries to return on each page. Valid values: 30, 50, and 100.

> The default value is 30.
The page number. The value must be greater than or equal to 0 and cannot exceed the maximum value of an integer. The default value is 0.
A client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. This prevents the same request from being submitted repeatedly.
The details of the returned parameters.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

- **true**: The request was successful.

- **false**: The request failed.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

TotalElements.description: The total number of backup set download records.

PageSize.description: The number of entries on each page.

BackupSetDownloadTaskDetail.description: The details of the backup set download task.

items.description: The details of the backup set download task.

BackupSetDownloadStatus.description:
The status of the backup set download. Valid values:

- **checking**: The system is performing a precheck.

- **init**: The precheck failed and the task has not started.

- **check\_pass**: The precheck is passed.

- **pause**: The task is paused.

- **schedule**: The task is waiting to be scheduled.

- **running**: The task is running.

- **stop**: The task failed.

- **finish**: The task is complete.

BackupSetDataSize.description: The size of the backup set data.

BackupSetDownloadTargetType.description:
The target type for the backup set download.

> This parameter is returned only for automatic downloads. The value "agent" indicates that a backup gateway is installed.

BackupSetDownloadDir.description:
The folder on the server where the backup set is downloaded.

> This parameter has a value only for automatic downloads.

ErrMessage.example: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException.

BackupSetDownloadCreateTime.description: The UNIX timestamp that indicates when the task was created.

BackupPlanId.description: The ID of the backup plan.

BackupSetDownloadInternetUrl.description:
The public download URL for the backup set.

> This parameter has a value only for manual downloads after the data format is transformed.

BackupSetId.description: The ID of the source backup set.

BackupSetDownloadIntranetUrl.description:
The internal download URL for the backup set.

> This parameter has a value only for manual downloads after the data format is transformed.

BackupGatewayId.description: The ID of the backup gateway. This parameter has a value only for automatic downloads.

BackupSetDownloadWay.description:
The download method. Valid values:

- **manual**: Manual download.

- **auto**: Automatic download.

BackupSetDownloadFinishTime.description: The UNIX timestamp that indicates when the task was complete.

BackupSetJobType.description:
The type of the source backup set task. Valid values:

- **cbs\_backup\_sub\_full**: Logical full backup task.

- **cbs\_backup\_sub\_cont**: Logical incremental backup task.

BackupSetDownloadTaskId.description: The ID of the backup set download task.

BackupSetDownloadTaskName.description: The name of the backup set download task.

BackupSetDataFormat.description:
The data format of the downloaded backup set. Valid values:

- **Native**

- **SQL**

- **CSV**

- **JSON**

BackupSetCode.description: The code of the source backup set.

The status of the DLA service for the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **Running**: DLA is running.
*   **Closing**: DLA is being disabled.
*   **Closed**: DLA is disabled.

ErrMessage.example: The specified parameter %s value is not valid.

AutoAdd.description:
Specifies whether to enable the feature of automatically adding incremental data to a data lake. If this feature is enabled, DBS adds the backup sets that are newly generated to the data lake that is created for the backup schedule. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the feature.
*   **false**: disables the feature.

HaveJobFailed.description:
Indicates whether a failed DLA task exists in the return result. Valid values:

*   **true**: A failed DLA task exists.
*   **false**: No failed DLA task exists.

ModifyBackupObjects.summary: Modifies the backup objects in a Database Backup Service (DBS) backup plan.

schema.description: The ID of the backup plan.

The backup objects, specified as a JSON string. The format is as follows:

```
[
    {
        "DBName":"The name of the database to be backed up",
        "SchemaName":"The name of the schema to be backed up",
        "TableIncludes":[{
        	"TableName":"The name of the table to be backed up"
        }],
        "TableExcludes":[{
            "TableName":"The name of a table in the database that does not need to be backed up"
        }]
    }
]
```

- If only `DBName` is specified and no rules are configured for other sub-objects, all objects in the database are backed up.

- If `DBName` is specified and rules are configured for some objects, objects without configured rules are not backed up by default. Object names can be defined using the following regular expressions:

  - A period (`.`) matches any single character except for `\r\n`.

  - An asterisk (`*`) matches the preceding subexpression zero or more times. For example, `h*llo` matches strings such as `hllo` and `heeeello`.

  - A question mark (`?`) matches the preceding subexpression zero or one time. For example, `h.?llo` matches `hllo` and `hello`, but not `haello`.

  - A character set (`[characters]`) matches any single character within the brackets. For example, `h[aello]` matches `hallo` and `hello`.

  - A negated character set (`[^characters]`) matches any single character not within the brackets. For example, `h[^ae]llo` matches `hcllo` and `hdllo`, but not `hallo` or `hello`.

  - A character range (`[character1-character2]`) matches any character within the specified range, such as `[0-9]` or `[a-z]`.

> `SchemaName` and `NewSchemaName` are used only for MSSQL. For other databases, use the `DBName` and `NewDBName` parameters to define database names.
A client token to ensure the idempotence of the request. This prevents the same request from being submitted multiple times.
The details of the returned parameters.

- **true**: The request was successful.
